educational.preview_text: One homeowner caught this early and saved $8,400 in damage
educational.body:
Hi [FIRST_NAME],

Termite swarm season just started in [CITY], and I'm already getting panicked calls from homeowners who had no idea they had a problem.

Here are the 5 signs most people miss until it's too late:

1. MUD TUBES on your foundation
Look like dried dirt lines running up from ground to wood. Termites build these as highways.

2. HOLLOW-SOUNDING WOOD
Tap your baseboards and door frames. Hollow sound = they've eaten the inside.

3. DISCARDED WINGS near windows
After swarming, termites shed wings. Little piles near windows = active colony nearby.

4. TINY HOLES in drywall
Size of a pinhead. Often mistaken for nail holes.

5. STUCK DOORS or sagging floors
Termite damage causes wood to warp. Not just "house settling."

Saw any of these? Don't panic, but don't wait either.

We're offering free 30-minute inspections this week. I'll check your property thoroughly and give you honest answers - even if that means you don't need treatment.
